customer_addr:
9330 Camatta Creek Rd
Santa Margarita, CA 93453

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, the facility did not have documentation of meeting the requirement for regularly scheduled visits to
the premises by the attending veterinarian (AV) in accordance with their Program of Veterinary Care which is every 6
months. The formal arrangement with an attending or consulting veterinarian shall include regularly scheduled visits to the
premises, in addition to the written program of veterinary care. The attending veterinarian had not signed the program of
veterinary care since 07/2022. Each dealer shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case
of a part-time attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program
of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor.
Correct by: 04/05/2024

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was a black tailed deer at the facility that had superficial abrasions on the face, neck, flanks, and rump from a
Fallow buck that had been previously been co-housed with the deer. The facility had observed the injuries first thing in the
morning and immediately separated the buck into a different pasture, but the attending veterinarian had not been notified.
The deer also had visible signs of prior injuries from a prior incident that the owner reported also treating but had not
discussed with the attending veterinarian. All animals should be observed on a daily basis, with any problems conveyed to
the attending veterinarian in a timely manner. Failure to consult with a veterinarian and provide appropriate diagnostics
and treatment can result in a poor outcome for animals.
Correct by: 03/22/2024

Several rusting discarded cages, old farm equipment, and other discarded items on the grounds with birds free on the
grounds. The peacocks at the facility are free-roaming and have access to all areas. There were at least eight adult
peacocks observed walking around the areas of clutter at the time of inspection. Discarded matter can cause injury to the
free-ranging animals as well as serve as living areas for rodents and other pests. The facility must ensure the premises
where housing facilities are located, including surrounding grounds, are kept clean to facilitate proper animal husbandry
and sanitation.
Correct by: 04/05/2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility did not have a documented environmental enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their
avian species as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must develop, document and follow a species
appropriate plan for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan
must be approved by the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental
enrichment, special considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan regulation and be in accordance with currently
accepted professional standards.
Correct by: 04/05/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At time of inspection, the facility did not have documentation of meeting the requirement for regularly scheduled visits to 
the premises by the attending veterinarian (AV) in accordance with their Program of Veterinary Care which is every 6 
months. The formal arrangement with an attending or consulting veterinarian shall include regularly scheduled visits to the 
premises, in addition to the written program of veterinary care. The attending veterinarian had not signed the program of 
veterinary care since 07/2022. Each dealer shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case 
of a part-time attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program 
of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor.  
Correct by: 04/05/2024 
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was a black tailed deer at the facility that had superficial abrasions on the face, neck, flanks, and rump from a 
Fallow buck that had been previously been co-housed with the deer. The facility had observed the injuries first thing in the 
morning and immediately separated the buck into a different pasture, but the attending veterinarian had not been notified. 
The deer also had visible signs of prior injuries from a prior incident that the owner reported also treating but had not 
discussed with the attending veterinarian. All animals should be observed on a daily basis, with any problems conveyed to 
the attending veterinarian in a timely manner. Failure to consult with a veterinarian and provide appropriate diagnostics 
and treatment can result in a poor outcome for animals. 
Correct by: 03/22/2024 
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Several rusting discarded cages, old farm equipment, and other discarded items on the grounds with birds free on the 
grounds. The peacocks at the facility are free-roaming and have access to all areas. There were at least eight adult 
peacocks observed walking around the areas of clutter at the time of inspection. Discarded matter can cause injury to the 
free-ranging animals as well as serve as living areas for rodents and other pests. The facility must ensure the premises 
where housing facilities are located, including surrounding grounds, are kept clean to facilitate proper animal husbandry 
and sanitation.

Correct by: 04/05/2024 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility did not have a documented environmental enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their 
avian species as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must develop, document and follow a species 
appropriate plan for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan 
must be approved by the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental 
enrichment, special considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan regulation and be in accordance with currently 
accepted professional standards. 
Correct by: 04/05/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
